title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 11.6 - Discovery of insider relationship
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 11.6 - Discovery of insider relationship

State Regulations

If a bank becomes aware of the existence of an insider
relationship after entering into a transaction for which approval would have
been required under section
11.3
of this Part, the bank shall
promptly report such transaction to the Superintendent at the address of the

Banking Department set forth in section
1.1
of Supervisory Policy G 1 of
this Title, except that no such report need be made by a New York bank other
than a credit union if the amount involved is less than $5,000 or by a credit
union if the amount involved is less than $4,000. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
11.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
